Issues.Title: Apply clipping and translation transforms correctly (#3990)
Issues.Body:
#### Port of #3990 fix for #3975

Logic was off for some of the cases where we set up an `HDC` for drawing and we weren't applying clipping or translation transforms when we needed to. For the `ToolStrip` this causes the background of the parent to fill over the `ToolStrip` background.

This has implications for most rendering where a clip or transform is applied.

Add tests for the `HDC` handling struct to validate application of `Graphics` properties.

Fixes #3975


## Proposed changes

- Fix logic in `DeviceContextHDCScope`
- Add tests for property application

## Customer Impact

- Background color isn't visible in Toolstrip (possibly other internal controls, testing hasn't surfaced any others yet)
- Customer or control vendor's controls that utilize clipping or origin transforms may not render correctly if they utilize ControlPaint or base class rendering

## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Low

## Screenshots

### Before

Visual styles enabled and disabled; Professional and ManagerRenderMode RenderMode
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8184940/94067041-25448c00-fda2-11ea-8a8a-67cb7b96170b.png)


### After

Visual styles enabled and disabled; Professional and ManagerRenderMode RenderMode
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8184940/94068165-afd9bb00-fda3-11ea-9a11-130b60d6c58b.png)


`RenderMode.System` (not the default) was validated to be unimpacted by this change.

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manually validated screen shots for various permutations
- Wrote regression tests for HDC/Graphics property application

Issues.Title: Winforms is still using netcoreapp5.0 instead of net5.0 as the TargetFramework
Issues.Body:
We embed the TargetFramework value in the assembly's metadata as part of the `TargetFrameworkAttribute`. I noticed that both winforms and wpf are still using netcoreapp5.0 as the tfm which got replaced by net5.0.

Do we know who reads that attribute and if we need to fix this before we ship?

cc @RussKie @JeremyKuhne @Tanya-Solyanik @ericstj
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Winforms is still using netcoreapp5.0 instead of net5.0 as the TargetFramework" (#3989)

Issues.Title: [release/3.1] Remove CPD on dependency coming from core-setup
Issues.Body:
Both the CPD parent and the dependency are coming from core-setup, so this is invalid on strict-coherency.

Issues.Title: The element added to the group is not displayed in the ListView after adding of group
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/docs/issue-guide.md -->

* .NET Core Version: **5.0.100-rc.1.20420.14**

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: **Yes**, tested in net472, netcoreapp3.1

**Repro steps:**
1. Create application with ListView.
2. Create ListViewGroup
3. Add ListViewItem to ListViewGroup
4. Add ListViewGroup to ListView.
5. Or use attached project [WindowsFormsApp3.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5271938/WindowsFormsApp3.zip)

**Actual:**
`ListViewItem` is not displayed in `ListView` because `ListItemView.ListView = null`.  I think ListView should be set for item when we add group with this item to ListView.

As a result `ListViewItem.AccesibleObject` may either throw `InvalidOperationException`, when attempting to access an item which added to a group, but have not link to the listview (2), or have a stable/incorrect reference to the listview when its group is removed from the listview (3)

**Expected:**
1. `ListViewItem` is displayed in ListView, if added to a group which is then added to a listview.
2. `ListViewItem` has a reference to the listview, when a group is added to the listview
2. `ListViewItem` has a reference to the listview removed, when a group is removed from the listview


**Notes:**

 ```
    var group = new ListViewGroup("Test group");

    // this item is not shown in the listview, and doens't have reference to listview
    // i.e. item1.ListView = null
    ListViewItem item1 = new ListViewItem("You don't see me");
    group.Items.Add(item1);
    listView2.Groups.Add(group);

    // this items is shown in the listview, item2.ListView <-- listView2
    ListViewItem item2 = new ListViewItem("You see me", group);
    listView2.Items.Add(item2);
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The element added to the group is not displayed in the ListView after adding of group" (#3987)

Issues.Title: Cursor cannot load all supported file formats
Issues.Body:
**.NET Core Version:**
all .NET Core and Desktop Framework

**Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?:**
Yes

**Problem description:**

Loading a cursor making use of alpha transparency by filename or stream does not work correctly when done through WinForms and produces a black cursor image (possibly the cursor mask instead of the actual cursor?)

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5845814/93937070-6fd4f280-fd27-11ea-8994-54a41823e603.png)

WinForms is [using `IPicture` interop](https://source.dot.net/#System.Windows.Forms/System/Windows/Forms/Cursor.cs,4a07b3923561f20f) to load cursors instead of the win32 cursor API and its unclear if OLE simply doesn't support alpha transparency, or if WinForms is doing something wrong in the interop.

**Expected behavior:**

The rendering should match the builtin hand cursor Windows uses (since in fact its the same file). You can also work around the bug by doing manual interop and calling [LoadCursorFromFile](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/nf-winuser-loadcursorfromfilew). For streams this requires saving the stream to a file first, though.

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5845814/93937047-62b80380-fd27-11ea-8ed9-3693fe220bdc.png)

**Minimal repro:**

Add a button and set the cursor to a file containing alpha transparency, for example the hand cursor distributed with Windows.

`button1.Cursor = new Cursor(Path.Combine(Environment.GetFolderPath(Environment.SpecialFolder.Windows), "Cursors\\aero_link.cur"));`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Cursor cannot load all supported file formats" (#3979)

Issues.Title: Cannot change the BackColor of ToolStrip control
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.NET 5.0.100-rc.2.20471.13

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

**More Info:**

1. This is a regression issue, it does not occur in .NET SDK 5.0.100-Preview.8.20417.9, it start from .NET 5.0 RC1.
2. This issue also can reproduce in the Properties window(design mode). 

**Problem description:**

Cannot change the BackColor of ToolStrip control
![core](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864985/93864590-b4e13080-fcf7-11ea-89c0-64f3c91ef716.png)


**Expected behavior:**

The BackColor of ToolStrip control can be changed correctly. 
![framework](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864985/93864605-bad71180-fcf7-11ea-9094-46caaa29e81d.png)

**Minimal repro:**
[Testapp.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5260320/Testapp.zip)
1. Launch the attached project in VS and run it.
2. Try to change the BackColor property in PropertyGrid and check the result.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Cannot change the BackColor of ToolStrip control" (#3975)

Issues.Title: WInForms TGA support
Issues.Body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/idea/823406/winforms-tga-support.html)._ --- Would like for VS2019 WinForms to support TGAs at least as much as it supports other image formats. Simply displaying a TGA in a picturebox would be a good start. --- ### Original Comments #### Feedback Bot on 11/18/2019, 06:12 PM: Thank you for taking the time to provide your suggestion. We will do some preliminary checks to make sure we can proceed further. We'll provide an update once the issue has been triaged by the product team. #### Feedback Bot on 9/22/2020, 05:48 AM:

Your suggestion has been queued up for prioritization. Feature suggestions are prioritized based on the value to our broader developer community and the product roadmap. We may not be able to pursue this one immediately, but we will continue to monitor it for community input

Issues.Title: Prepare CLI VB template for vs16.8 P4 VS templates.
Issues.Body:
This fixes #3893, and also is needed to make https://github.com/dotnet/templates/pull/375 work.

## Proposed changes

Enables the following experiences for Visual Basic WinForms templates:
* Creates a new VB WinForms App V3.1 from the CLI. (Default: `dotnet new winforms --language VB` )
* Creates a new VB WinForms App net5.0 ( `--Framework net5.0` )
* Creates a new VB WinForms App net5.0 WITH Application Framework support ( `--Framework net5.0 --use-app-framework=true` )
* New: Works together with the newly activated VS VB template (which have been disabled before).

## Customer Impact

Will enable the Customer to use the Visual Basic Application Framework for Windows Forms Apps for >=net 5.0.

## Regression? 

No.

## Risk

Low. Only affecting VB templates.

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

Manual testing of the new templates.

Issues.Title: Fixing the incorrect ScreenReader blue rectangle for a new character when typing (Text pattern area)
Issues.Body:
Fixes #3897

## Proposed changes

- Raise `Text_TextChangedEvent` to Narrator shows the correct blue rectangle when typing new characters in Edit controls (should work as in Win32 RichTextBox)
- Do not raise the event for RichTextBox because Win32 provides unmanaged Text pattern for it

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- A user orientates on the blue rectangle when entering text, and the current behavior can be confusing. This fix implements expected behavior for all text controls as in RichTextBox

Issues.Title: Improve localisation support by adding a way to bind control string properties to a specific resource type and key
Issues.Body:
Currently, WinForms allows you to localise your controls, which is good. However, localisation support is limited to the very simple case of having a resource file of the same name next to the control being localised. This prevents reuse of common strings across a project.

Ideally, any string property on a WinForms control should be able to be bound **at design-time** to any arbitrary resource key in any arbitrary resource file. To my mind, this will take one of two forms:

* A new property, `ResourceType`, on every control: if set, this will look on the specific type for resource keys of the same name as the autogenerated localisation resources, and attempt to bind to them.There should be validation to ensure the type being bound to defines the requisite keys for the control.
* The designer for every string property on a control will be changed to have a ... ellipsis button next to the property. If clicked, this will open a popout showing two dropdowns: a **resource type** and a **resource key**. The latter will depend on the former, and once a selection is made for both, the property in question will be bound to that resource type + key.

Note that the above is a hierarchical structure: first the control property's resource type + key will be checked, then the control's ResourceType for a matching key, and the standard infrastructure enabled by `form.Localizable` will be checked last. This enables extreme flexibility for localising resources.

**Will this feature affect UI controls?**

Yes, as above.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Improve localisation support by adding a way to bind control string properties to a specific resource type and key" (#3966)

Issues.Title: With NET 5 RC2 SDK installed, "net5.0-windows" instead of "net5.0" should be displayed for winforms/wpf help description in CLI.
Issues.Body:
**Repro steps:**
1.Install NET 5 RC2 build(5.0.100-rc.2.20466.4).
2. In CLI, run "dotnet new winforms --help" or "dotnet new wpf --help".
3. Check the help contents displaying.

**Expected Result:**
"net5.0" should be displayed as "net5.0-windows"

**Actual Result:**
Still display as "net5.0"
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65637796/93433959-15d4c700-f8fa-11ea-9b46-de6792f0a95e.png)
